materials.raw_text: B2: 40 g, Co: 20 g, La: 10 g, Ni: 140 g, Tb: 10 g

sourcing.instructions: B (Boron): Chemical supply store; Co (Cobalt): Metal supplier; La (Lanthanum): Rare earth metal supplier; Ni (Nickel): Metal supplier; Tb (Terbium): Rare earth metal supplier.
steps: B (Boron): Chemical supply store; Co (Cobalt): Metal supplier; La (Lanthanum): Rare earth metal supplier; Ni (Nickel): Metal supplier; Tb (Terbium): Rare earth metal supplier.

1. Accurately weigh each material using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry stainless steel container, combine 40 g of Boron, 20 g of Cobalt, 10 g of Lanthanum, 140 g of Nickel, and 10 g of Terbium. 3. Use a mechanical stirrer to mix the powders thoroughly for 10 minutes, ensuring an even blend.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Accurately weigh each material using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry stainless steel container, combine 40 g of Boron, 20 g of Cobalt, 10 g of Lanthanum, 140 g of Nickel, and 10 g of Terbium. 3. Use a mechanical stirrer to mix the powders thoroughly for 10 minutes, ensuring an even blend.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace to 1200°C (2192°F) for 2 hours. 3. Ensure the furnace has a controlled atmosphere to prevent oxidation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace to 1200°C (2192°F) for 2 hours. 3. Ensure the furnace has a controlled atmosphere to prevent oxidation.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25°C) over 4-6 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled completely.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25°C) over 4-6 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled completely.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a belt sander with fine grit sandpaper to smooth any rough edges, maintaining the dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Optionally, apply a thin coat of sealant to protect the surface of the material. Allow sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a belt sander with fine grit sandpaper to smooth any rough edges, maintaining the dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Optionally, apply a thin coat of sealant to protect the surface of the material. Allow sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling.
